context.speaker: Ali
context.en_line: Hello Malika! Do you have a brother?

strings.value: Ha, akam bor. Uning ismi Karim.

context.speaker: Malika
context.en_line: Yes, I have a brother. His name is Karim.

context.speaker: Ali
context.en_line: Does he have a book?

strings.value: Ha, kitobi bor. Bu uning kitobi.

context.speaker: Malika
context.en_line: Yes, he has a book. This is his book.

context.speaker: Ali
context.en_line: Do you have a sister?

context.speaker: Malika
context.en_line: No, I don't have a sister. I have a brother.

strings.value: Mening singlim bor. Uning ismi Sara.

context.speaker: Ali
context.en_line: I have a sister. Her name is Sara.

context.speaker: Malika
context.en_line: That is nice! Does your father have a car?

context.speaker: Ali
context.en_line: No, he doesn't have a car.

strings.value: Bizning ajoyib o'qituvchimiz bor. O'qituvchimiz yaxshi.

context.speaker: Malika
context.en_line: We have a nice teacher. Our teacher is good.

context.speaker: Nilufar
context.en_line: Is there a teacher in the class?

strings.value: Ha, o'qituvchi bor. U mening o'qituvchim.

context.speaker: Bekzod
context.en_line: Yes, there is a teacher. She is my teacher.

context.speaker: Nilufar
context.en_line: Are there students in the class?

strings.value: Ha, talabalar bor. Besh talaba bor.

context.speaker: Bekzod
context.en_line: Yes, there are students. There are five students.

context.speaker: Nilufar
context.en_line: Is there a book on the table?

strings.value: Ha, stolda kitob bor. Bu sizning kitobingiz.

context.speaker: Bekzod
context.en_line: Yes, there is a book on the table. That is your book.

context.speaker: Nilufar
context.en_line: Is there a car at school?

context.speaker: Bekzod
context.en_line: No, there isn't a car at school.

context.speaker: Nilufar
context.en_line: Are there books in the bag?

strings.value: Yo'q, sumkada kitoblar yo'q. Sumka uyda.

context.speaker: Bekzod
context.en_line: No, there aren't books in the bag. The bag is at home.

context.speaker: Sara
context.en_line: Hello Karim! How are you?

context.speaker: Karim
context.en_line: I am fine, thank you. How are you?

context.speaker: Sara
context.en_line: I am happy today. Where is Ali?

context.speaker: Karim
context.en_line: Ali is in the class. He has a book.

context.speaker: Sara
context.en_line: Where is the book?

context.speaker: Karim
context.en_line: The book is on the table.

context.speaker: Sara
context.en_line: When is the class?

context.speaker: Karim
context.en_line: The class is at nine. It is in the morning.

context.speaker: Sara
context.en_line: This is good! Why are you happy?

strings.value: Mening ham singlim bor. U uyda.

context.speaker: Karim
context.en_line: I have a sister too. She is at home.

context.speaker: Madina
context.en_line: Where are the students?

strings.value: Ular sinfda. O'qituvchilari ham u yerda.

context.speaker: Vali
context.en_line: They are in the class. Their teacher is there too.

context.speaker: Madina
context.en_line: Where is my bag?

context.speaker: Vali
context.en_line: Your bag is on the table.

context.speaker: Madina
context.en_line: How is your father?

context.speaker: Vali
context.en_line: He is fine. He is at home now.

context.speaker: Madina
context.en_line: Why is your sister at school?

context.speaker: Vali
context.en_line: She has a class. There is an exam.

context.speaker: Madina
context.en_line: Why are you happy?

context.speaker: Vali
context.en_line: I am happy. I have a book. The book is good.

strings.value: To'g'ri! 'Have' = I, You, We, They bilan ishlatiladi.
'Have' — I, You, We, They uchun. He/She/It uchun 'Has' kerak!
'Have' — I, You, We, They bilan. 'Has' — He, She, It bilan. Uchinchi shaxs birlikda 'has' kerak.
Ha, akam bor. Uning ismi Karim.
To'g'ri! 'Has' = He, She, It (uchinchi shaxs birlik) uchun.
'Has' — He, She, It (uchinchi shaxs birlik) uchun maxsus shakl. Boshqa shaxslar uchun 'have' ishlatiladi.
Ha, kitobi bor. Bu uning kitobi.
'Don't' = do + not. I/You/We/They bilan 'don't have' ishlatiladi. He/She/It uchun 'doesn't have' kerak.
⚠️ Oddiy hozirgi zamon (Present Simple) inkor uchun 'DON'T HAVE' kerak!
'Doesn't' = does + not. 'Does' allaqachon uchinchi shaxs. Shuning uchun 'have' (HAS emas!) kerak: 'doesn't HAVE'.
'There is' — birlik uchun. Ko'plik uchun 'There are' kerak!
'There is' = BITTA narsa mavjud. 'There are' = KO'P narsa mavjud. Sonni qarang!
Nega 'there is' va 'there are' farqi bor?
Ha, o'qituvchi bor. U mening o'qituvchim.
'There are' — ko'plik uchun. Birlik uchun 'There is' kerak!
'Are' = ko'plik uchun TO BE shakli. Students, books, teachers = ko'plik → 'There ARE'.
Ha, talabalar bor. Besh talaba bor.
To'g'ri! 'There isn't' = bitta narsa MAVJUD EMAS.
'There is' + 'not' → 'There isn't'. Birlik uchun inkor shakl.
To'g'ri! 'There aren't' = ko'p narsalar mavjud EMAS.
'There are' + 'not' → 'There aren't'. Ko'plik uchun inkor shakl. Birlik uchun 'isn't' ishlatiladi.
Yo'q, sumkada kitoblar yo'q. Sumka uyda.
Yo'q, Ali qayerda ekanini bilmayman. Ali qayerda?
'Where' = joy haqida savol. Savol tartibi: WHERE + IS/ARE + Subject? Darak gapdan farqli tartib!
Siz bilan uchrashganimda nima deyishim kerak?
To'g'ri! 'How are you?' = siz QANDAY ekanligingizni so'raydi.
'How' = holat yoki usul. 'How are you?' = Qanday ekansiz? 'How' bilan turli savollar tuzish mumkin.
'When' = vaqt haqida savol. 'When + is/are + subject?' — vaqtni so'rash uchun.
'Why' = sabab/sababni so'rash. 'Why + are/is + subject + adjective?' — sababni aniqlash.
IN = ichida (in the room, in the bag). ON = ustida (on the table). AT = aniq joy (at school). Uch xil joy ko'rsatish!
'On' = sirt ustida. On the table, on the wall, on the floor — narsa sirt USTIDA tursa 'on' kerak.
To'g'ri! 'At' = aniq joy (at home, at school, at work).
'At' = aniq belgilangan joy. At home, at school, at work — bu joylarning NOMI bilan 'at' kerak.
Mening ham singlim bor. U uyda.
'Too' = HAM. Bu qo'shimcha qilish uchun ishlatiladi!
'Too' = ham. Gap OXIRIDA keladi: 'I am happy TOO.' 'Also' esa gap o'rtasida: 'I also have...'
Ingliz tilida ayting: 'Mening ham singlim bor'
⚠️ 'Too' gap oxirida keladi: 'I have a sister TOO'!
